source: Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate
Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate,Michael J Kalagias for Congress
text: Come and join us and hear more about our plans on the campaign trail.

source: Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate
text: I wanted to share with you one of the main reasons I am running for US Senate.  Last year, a law was passed that makes it difficult for third parties to get on the ballot. The rationale was to make the ballot less cluttered. This is comical when you look at the 2020 ballot. In the Arkansas House of Representatives, 51 seats are UNCONTESTED. That essentially means the candidate has already won.  If not for third party candidates and Independent candidates, 8 of those seats would also be UNCONTESTED. Another 2 seats will be determined by party primary and afterwards, the seat will be UNCONTESTED.  In the Arkansas State Senate, there are 7 UNCONTESTED seats, with 2 others being determined by party primary. My hope is that my campaign will encourage the people of Arkansas to run for office and for other parties to engage in the political process. It is not good for power to be hoarded by one party. Things like the “petition killer bill” are introduced when a party is in power and feels like it can do whatever it pleases.  We must fight to keep our republic healthy. We need diverse ideas. We must find a way to work together and not continue in political tribalism.  So, I say to the people of Arkansas, go and CONTEST those seats! #1stAmendment

source: Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate
text: Attended the Interfaith Unity Prayer breakfast hosted by the MLK Commission of Arkansas' Department of Education at the Governor's mansion. A great event in honor of Dr. King's legacy of equality. One of my favorite quotes from Dr. King is this, "Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere." Let us remember that just because you are not effected by something presently does not mean it will not or may not affect your freedom or Liberty in the future. We are all champions of justice, so take up your mantle.

source: Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate
Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate
Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate
text: We should not be directly attacking high level government officials without a full declaration of war from Congress. I do not support getting involved in another war that does not involve direct defense of the nation. It is unwise for us to continue intervening in the affairs of sovereign nations. We have spent almost 20 years and $ 2.4 trillion in Iraq and Afghanistan  and have not accomplished anything other than continued destabilization of a sovereign nation. We need to stop being the "world police". Are we willing to commit more money and the lives of young American men and women on wars that do not bring us to a resolution of offenses against our country. Cool heads must prevail now. Do not engage in another war unless there is a clear end. Do not act rashly, we have always been a beacon of light and hope in this dark world. Is this the moment where we become the bad guys? #itsyourrepublic

text: Is our government becoming more authoritarian, or is it just me?

text: Secret courts deliberating whether an American citizen should or should not be spied upon with a low threshold of accountability is a recipe for abuse and corruption. End it. #itsyourrepublic

source: Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate,Congressman Thomas Massie
text: This week, we were given 19 hours to review the 3,488 page National Defense Authorization Act — a bill that authorizes $738 billion of spending in FY2020. The bill passed. I voted no.

source: Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate
text: I work in Corrections and our criminal justice system needs to change. There should be NO money making incentives to incarcerate people.  No one cares until it hits them in their backyard,  I say you have a duty to make sure those in power do not create a system that locks people up and uses them in a profiteering industry. #itsyourrepublic

source: Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate
text: Can we be honest with one another for just a moment? The real issue is who will dominate the energy market.... not what they are trying to convince us is the issue.

source: Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate
text: Many people tried to convince me to run as a Democrat or a Republican, I chose to run as a Third party candidate because I believe in Liberty and I do not want to be a cog in the machine that is ruining our country. We need to work together. #itsyourrepublic

source: Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate
text: I see a lot of articles about no Democrat to oppose Senator Tom Cotton. Friends, I am on the ballot and I want to make a difference for the people and keep this country free. I need your help. #itsyourrepublic

source: Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate
text: Here within the next few days I will be addressing some of the hot button issues we continue to talk about over and over again. For the most part these issues fall right down party lines. As I have said before I have lived in several different countries. A common theme is that they have homogeneous  cultures and have a common origin with their countrymen. We do not have that history in the United States and we usually compete with one another regarding which ideal should be imposed on the on the rest (I oppose this). Now issue 1, healthcare.  In the UK or Scandinavian countries they have a single payer system and for many of those that live in that country it works. We attempted something  like that with the Affordable Care Act. Even after its passage it remained an issue of partisan politics...with the call to repeal and replace by the Republicans.  When the Senate took up a vote to finally  do that, the late Senator  John McCain's health took a turn for the worst. I wonder....in those quiet moments when he was alone with his thoughts...did he think about the scores of Americans who would have to face a life altering illness, and their future was depending on his vote....I wonder what made him choose to not vote along party lines. We live in the most prosperous nation in the world and we are the descendants of men and women who have done great things. Surely we can fix our healthcare system. If we can send robots to Mars, surely we can devise a way for people to receive the medicine they need to survive without going into debt. We need to let people deal with their providers directly and cut out the middleman(they didn't complain about the ACA). We need to stop the FDA issuing government backed monopolies. We need to remove regulations that block a direct pay form of healthcare that may be the answer to slowing the skyrocketing costs of healthcare. Surely we can do it without the government dictating what should be done. #itsyourrepublic

source: Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate
text: If you have been watching  the impeachment inquiry this confirms what I said during my Capitol View interview. That after decades of fighting the Russians in the Cold War they found a way to beat us at our own game. Infiltrate our elections and stoke the hyper partisanship in our country. It's time to set aside our differences and work together. Don't help the attack. Don't be a part of the problem, be a part of the solution. #havesomeintegrity

source: Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate
Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate
text: For Arkansas to be such a "Red" state.. these taxes don't match the philosophy.

source: Ricky Dale Harrington Jr for US Senate
text: This country belongs to each and every  citizen regardless  of race, creed, national  origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, religious preference, etc. This American experiment was meant to forge a country where people are truly  free from oppression.  We have failed  at times  but we press on to the goal and ideals that we all are equal and have a voice in the machinations of our government.  I am running  as a Libertarian on principle.  Because  I could no longer participate in the two party system that has made a mockery of our beloved ideals. We do not require  absolute  capitulation from those whose ideas differ from us, they have a human right to seek out a life for themselves  that is peaceful and does no harm to another. We must stop the partisanship or it will destroy our country. I only care about doing the right thing because  it is the right thing to do. I don't have an illustrious background. I didn't go to the top universities or win awards and accolades.  I have spent my entire adult life helping people. Serving the homeless,  spending  time with people in mental health crisis, engaging  in humanitarian efforts and caring for people. It is my  sole calling  in life. We must work together to preserve our union. #itsyourrepublic
